tool.name: PlsComponents
tool.description: : Wrapper of the scikit-learn PLSRegression method.

param.name: input_dataset_path
param.label: input CSV file
param.help: Path to the input dataset. Format: [input].csv

param.name: outname_output_results_path
param.label: output CSV name
param.help: Table with R2 and MSE for calibration and cross-validation data for the best number of components Format: [output].csv

param.name: outname_output_plot_path
param.label: output PNG name
param.help: Path to the Mean Square Error plot Format: [output].png

param.name: sele
param.label: Take tool settings:
param.help: Select where tool settings are to be read from

param.name: properties
param.label: Configuration file
param.help: File containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: jsonstr
param.label: JSON string
param.help: JSON string containing tool settings. See below for the syntax

param.name: features
param.label: features
param.help: Features or columns from your dataset you want to use for fitting. You can specify either a list of columns names from your input dataset, a list of columns indexes or a range of columns indexes. Formats: { "columns": ["column1", "column2"] } or { "indexes": [0, 2, 3, 10, 11, 17] } or { "range": [[0, 20], [50, 102]] }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked. (Json)

param.name: target
param.label: target
param.help: Dependent variable you want to predict from your dataset. You can specify either a column name or a column index. Formats: { "column": "column3" } or { "index": 21 }. In case of mulitple formats, the first one will be picked. (Json)

param.name: optimise
param.label: optimise
param.help: Whether or not optimise the process of MSE calculation. Beware, if True selected, the process can take a long time depending on the **max_components** value.

param.name: max_components
param.label: max_components
param.help: Maximum number of components to use by default for PLS queries.

param.name: cv
param.label: cv
param.help: Specify the number of folds in the cross-validation splitting strategy. Value must be between 2 and number of samples in the dataset.

param.name: scale
param.label: scale
param.help: Whether or not to scale the input dataset.
